biography: Mehmet Haberal, is the founder of Başkent University in Ankara, Turkey, best known for becoming the first transplant surgeon in Turkey after leading the team that performed Turkey's first living-related kidney transplant in 1975, after he returned from surgical training under the mentorship of American surgeon Thomas Starzl, with whom he also performed some of the longest surviving early liver transplantations.

### 2. Medical Philosophy

Dr. Haberal's medical philosophy is deeply rooted in a patient-centered approach. He believes that every patient is an individual with unique needs and concerns, and that their care should be tailored accordingly. He emphasizes the importance of communication and collaboration with patients, ensuring that they are fully informed about their condition and treatment options. He strongly believes in empowering patients to make informed decisions about their healthcare.

His approach to patient care is characterized by a combination of technical excellence and genuine compassion. He understands that undergoing surgery, especially a complex procedure like organ transplantation, can be a daunting experience for patients and their families. He strives to create a supportive and reassuring environment for his patients, providing them with emotional support and guidance throughout the entire process.

Dr. Haberal is also a strong advocate for innovation in medicine. He believes that continuous research and development are essential for improving patient outcomes and advancing the field of transplant surgery. He actively seeks out new technologies and techniques that can enhance the safety and effectiveness of transplant procedures. He is also a strong supporter of clinical trials, recognizing their importance in evaluating new treatments and improving the standard of care.

Beyond the immediate clinical setting, Dr. Haberal adheres to a strict ethical code. He is deeply committed to upholding the highest standards of medical ethics, particularly in the sensitive area of organ transplantation. He is a strong advocate for equitable access to organ transplantation and condemns any form of organ trafficking or unethical organ procurement practices. He believes that organ transplantation should be available to all patients who need it, regardless of their socioeconomic status or geographic location.

### 3. Key Procedures & Clinical Expertise

Dr. Haberal's clinical expertise lies primarily in the field of transplant surgery. He has performed a vast number of transplant procedures throughout his career, including kidney, liver, pancreas, and heart transplants. His technical skills are widely recognized, and he is known for his ability to handle complex and challenging cases.

In kidney transplantation, Dr. Haberal has extensive experience in both deceased donor and living donor transplants. He is proficient in all aspects of the procedure, from organ procurement and preservation to recipient preparation and surgical implantation. He is also skilled in managing post-transplant complications, such as rejection, infection, and vascular complications.

His expertise in liver transplantation is equally impressive. He has performed numerous liver transplants for patients with a wide range of liver diseases, including cirrhosis, hepatitis, and liver cancer. He is adept at performing both orthotopic and living donor liver transplants. He is also skilled in managing the complex medical issues that can arise in liver transplant recipients, such as biliary complications, hepatic artery thrombosis, and recurrent liver disease.

Dr. Haberal's expertise extends to pancreas transplantation, a procedure that can provide a life-changing treatment for patients with type 1 diabetes. He has performed both simultaneous pancreas-kidney transplants and pancreas-after-kidney transplants. He is skilled in managing the unique challenges associated with pancreas transplantation, such as pancreatic enzyme leakage and rejection.

While his primary focus is on abdominal organ transplantation, Dr. Haberal also has experience in heart transplantation. He has performed heart transplants for patients with end-stage heart failure. He is skilled in managing the complex medical issues that can arise in heart transplant recipients, such as rejection, infection, and coronary artery disease.

In addition to his expertise in organ transplantation, Dr. Haberal also possesses a strong foundation in general surgery. This broad surgical background enables him to effectively manage a wide range of surgical problems that may arise in transplant patients.

### 5. Patient Impact & Community Work

The true measure of Dr. Haberal's success lies not only in his surgical skills and academic achievements but also in the positive impact he has had on the lives of his patients. ### 6. Legacy and Future Outlook

Dr. Mehmet Haberal's legacy as a pioneer in transplant surgery is firmly established. His work has helped to advance the field of transplant surgery and to improve the lives of countless patients.

Looking to the future, Dr. Haberal's influence will undoubtedly continue to shape the field of transplant surgery.
